title: A Phase 1b, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Pilot Study to Evaluate the Effects of NMRA-323511 Among Healthy Elderly and Adults With Agitation Associated With Dementia Due to Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief:
This study consists of 2 parts, Part A and Part B. Part A is a single center, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled cohort designed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics (PK) of NMRA-323511 among healthy elderly.

Part B is a multicenter, randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled, parallel-group cohort to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of NMRA-323511 among adults with Agitation Associated with Dementia due to Alzheimer's Disease.

Part A consists of a Screening Period (up to 28 days), a 10-day Treatment Period, and a 10- day Follow-up clinic visit after last dose of study treatment.

Part B consists of a Screening Period (up to 28 days), an 8-week Treatment Period, and a 10-day Follow-up clinic visit after last dose of study treatment.
drug: NMRA-323511 (trial name) — oral small-molecule; likely the same as Neumora's NMRA-511, a brain-penetrant vasopressin 1a receptor (V1aR) antagonist
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests NMRA-323511 for 'Agitation Associated with Dementia due to Alzheimer's Disease' (a behavioral/psychiatric symptom), so the intended effect is symptomatic reduction of agitation rather than disease modification or cognitive enhancement. citeturn3search0

Act: Registry and sponsor materials list the investigational product as NMRA-323511 in the trial record, and Neumora describes NMRA-511 as an oral, brain-penetrant V1a receptor antagonist being developed specifically for agitation in AD — indicating a small-molecule, neuropsychiatric-targeting agent. (NMRA-323511 appears to be the trial/code designation corresponding to NMRA-511). citeturn3search0turn2search3turn1search4

Reflect: Classification = 'neuropsychiatric symptom improvement' (fits definition: intervention aimed at reducing agitation/aggression). Note the naming ambiguity (NMRA-323511 vs NMRA-511) in public listings; mechanism and sponsor information support that this is a V1aR antagonist for symptomatic treatment of agitation, not a disease-modifying biologic or cognitive enhancer. citeturn3search0turn2search3
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational product is described in sponsor and registry materials as an oral, brain‑penetrant antagonist of the vasopressin 1a receptor (V1aR) being developed to reduce agitation/aggression (a neuropsychiatric symptom). V1aR is a G‑protein coupled neuropeptide receptor (vasopressin receptor), which falls under neurotransmitter/neuropeptide receptor targets. citeturn0search0turn1search0

Act: Registry entries for the trial list the study drug as NMRA‑323511 (trial code) and other Neumora sources identify the compound as NMRA‑511, a selective, brain‑penetrant V1aR antagonist being developed for agitation in AD — supporting that the mechanism is V1a receptor antagonism (a neurotransmitter receptor target). citeturn1search0turn1search6turn1search3

Reflect: Classification = 'D) Neurotransmitter Receptors'. The intervention is symptomatic (reducing agitation) and targets a specific neuropeptide receptor (V1aR). It is not primarily an anti‑amyloid, anti‑tau, inflammatory, metabolic, or multi‑target disease‑modifying approach, nor is it a non‑therapeutic diagnostic — so CADRO category D is the most specific fit. If later information indicated additional mechanisms (e.g., broad receptor panels or multi‑modal action), 'R) Multi‑target' might be considered, but current sources support a single neurotransmitter receptor target. citeturn0search0turn0search1

Web search results (key sources used): 1) Neumora press release announcing Phase 1b NMRA‑511 as a highly potent, brain‑penetrant vasopressin 1a receptor (V1aR) antagonist for AD agitation. citeturn0search0 2) Clinical trial registry entries showing the trial titled with NMRA‑323511 (NCT06546995) for agitation associated with dementia due to Alzheimer’s disease (phase 1b, Part A healthy elderly, Part B AD agitation). citeturn1search0turn1search3 3) AdisInsight/trial indexing that maps the trial drug to NMRA‑511 (NMRA 511 listed as primary drug). citeturn1search6 4) Additional registry/clinical listing pages that reference NMRA‑323511 as the trial code linked to Neumora’s NMRA‑511 program. citeturn1search4turn1search5
